item.description:
The 3rd Annual Hartford International Film Festival opens at the Bowtie Cinema on Thursday Nov. 6, 2008. "Trouble the Water" is a film shot by a resident of New Orlean's Ninth Ward who was not evacuted for Hurricaine Katrina. The family was not evacuated for 19 days. This film was winner of the Best Documentary of the 2008 Sundance Film Festival. The film will include a post film discussion moderated by DJ Buck of Hot 93.7, and Ben Smilowitz former head of Red Cross Disater Relief Team in New Orleans.

Tickets are $8.00 or by a HIFF 3 pass which allows you to see every film and go to two parties.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: 3rd Annual Hartford International Film Festival
